intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. stenoplecopsis, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems, typical of the genus Hieracium. This subspecies is native to specific regions in Europe, particularly in areas with calcareous soils. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered plant species.
